items.title: Last night we drove from Senator Hickenlooperâ€™s office to his...
items.content_html:
Sanctuary4All Colorado is in Park Hill, Denver.

Last night we drove from Senator Hickenlooperâ€™s office to his home to protest the vote he took on February 4th to deny undocumented immigrants access to COVID relief. Undocumented immigrants have paid over $118 million into Coloradoâ€™s unemployment fund, which they we unable to use, in addition to taxes paid into other social programs that we are barred from accessing. And of course, our taxes have paid Senator Hickenlooperâ€™s salary for years, first when he was mayor of Denver..., then as Governor of Colorado, and now as our senator. We turned out for Senator Hickenlooper, but he hasnâ€™t shown up for us. Which is why itâ€™s so important that, while we keep pushing him, we show up for each other. One way you can do that is through the solidarity meals program. You can order a meal from someone impacted by the U.S. immigration system for pickup on Saturdays. All proceeds go directly to the family cooking. Orders are open now at https://solidaritymeals.paperform.co

items.title: Si se pudo Thanks to you, Hilda is home again. As Congress...
items.content_html:
Sanctuary4All Colorado

Si se pudo Thanks to you, Hilda is home again. As Congress begins to discuss immigration policy that already mentions more surveillance and militarization at the border, it's critical we center the demands of border communities and refuse to use them as a bargaining chip. #revitalizenotmilitarize #nowall
Gracias a todos ustedes, Hilda ya regreso a casa! Mientras el congreso empieza a debatir nuevas propuestas migratorias, que ya propongan mas militarizacion y vigilancia en l...a frontera, es critico que respaldamos a comunidades fronterizas y que no los utlicemos como fichas de negociaciÃ³n.
#freehilda
